Question
========

In a study of the length of time it takes to make a decision about purchasing a home based on photo opportunities, researchers assigned 30 people randomly assigned to one of two conditions: (1) 20 photos of the house were shown and (2) 5 photos of the house were shown. The mean of group (1) was 2.0 hours and standard deviation 2.1; the mean of group (2) was 4.8 hours and standard deviation 3.2. The researchers assume that the standard deviations in the population are are equal and thus arrive at a *standard error* of 1.025 and 28 degrees of freedom. A 95% confidence interval for the difference *μ*~1~ - *μ*~2~ is

Answerlist
----------

* (-3.80;-1.80).
* (-4.90; -0.70).
* (-5.1; -0.90).

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* (-3.80;-1.80).: Incorrect
* (-4.90; -0.70).: Correct
* (-5.1; -0.90).: Incorrect
